title: This video doesn’t show Akhilesh Yadav being arrested for protests over Article 370. It’s an old video
subtitle: The video was actually taken in 2011 when Akhilesh Yadav was arrested by the Police for carrying a protest against the then Mayawati government
author: factly.in
vclaim:
On social media, a video that shows Akhilesh Yadav being held by Police during a protest is being shared widely with the claim that he was arrested for protesting against the center’s decision over Article 370. Let’s try to analyze the authenticity of the video and also, the claim made in the post. 



Claim: Video shows Akhilesh Yadav being arrested for protesting against the removal of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir. Fact: The video was taken in 2011 when Akhilesh Yadav was arrested by the Police for carrying out a protest against the then Mayawati government. Hence, the claim made in the post is FALSE.

When the video in the post was run through the ‘InVid’ plugin, several keyframes of the same were obtained. On subjecting these keyframes to reverse image search technique, a certain keyframe directed to a YouTube video, which was similar to the one posted on Facebook. When the timestamp of the video was checked, it was found to be uploaded on March 9, 2011, by “Times Now”. The video has the following description with it- “On the last day of Samajwadi Party’s state-wide agitation against the Mayawati government, party state president Akhilesh Yadav was today arrested at the Amausi airport as soon as he landed here from New Delhi”.

To conclude, the video doesn’t show Akhilesh Yadav being arrested for protests over Article 370. He was arrested in 2011 for carrying agitations against the then Mayawati’s government in U.P.
